content: Credit Card Lifestyle Asked by AnonymousAsked on 30 Jul 2019Will my credit score be affected if I spend less than the minimum spend on that credit card?Will my credit score be penalised or face any sort of changes if I don't hit the minimum spend? Am I still entitled to the flat cashback too?4 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardAnswered on 31 Jul 2019Not at all, as credit score is based on your ability to pay back to the credit card companies in full and on a timely basis. With regards to cashback, it depends on the terms of the CC you signed up for!0 comments3

Kenneth ChanLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 02 Aug 2019Short answer: No.But you shouldn't be really too bothered about your "credit score" unless you are planning to take out a loan in the future.0 comments1

Aik KaiLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 01 Aug 2019Hi there,No, your credit score will not be affected. Credit score or rating is a rating assigned to you that allows banks and other financial institutions to determine if you are a credit risk. If you are a high credit risk. banks won't grant you new credit cards or loans. If you are a low credit risk, banks will approve your new credit card and/or loan application. Nothing to do with minimum spend.And yes, as long as you make a valid transaction on your card, you will be entitled to the flat cashback.0 comments1

Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 31 Jul 2019Credit score will not be penalised. Credit score is affected by your ability to pay the credit card in full and on time.Cashback entitlement, Well this depends on what credit card you are refering to. If you refer to Standard chartered unlimited cashback then there is no min spend requirement. If you refer to other banks like OCBC365, then yes there is min spend required for cashback.0 comments1
